title: 108_hr482
content: The Act titled "Florida National Forest Land Management Act of 2003" defines terms like "Secretary" as the Secretary of Agriculture and "State" as the State of Florida. It also addresses the sale or exchange of land. The Secretary has the authority to sell or exchange parcels of Federal land in Florida under specified conditions. The described parcels include various tracts in Santa Rosa and Okaloosa Counties, totaling approximately 181.49 acres. The Secretary has the authority to sell or exchange parcels of Federal land in Florida, including tracts in Santa Rosa and Okaloosa Counties totaling approximately 181.49 acres. Specific parcels in Okaloosa County include a fairground, city ball park, landfill-golf course driving range, vacant lots in Bristol, and a tract southwest of Astor in Lake County. The Secretary has the authority to sell or exchange parcels of Federal land in Florida, including tracts in Lake County totaling approximately 327.93 acres. The Secretary has the authority to sell or exchange parcels of Federal land in Florida, including tracts in Marion County totaling approximately 79.58 acres. The land includes recreational residential lots on Lake Kerr and adjacent land, as well as a portion of the F.M. Arrendondo grant east of Ocala. The Secretary may modify legal descriptions for soliciting offers based on surveys or public interest. The Secretary has the authority to solicit offers for the sale or exchange of Federal land in Florida, including parcels in Marion County. Offers may be rejected if deemed inadequate or not in the public interest. The land can be sold publicly or privately, with the option to use a real estate broker and pay them a comparable commission. The Secretary of the Air Force must approve the sale or exchange of specified land parcels. Cash equalization may be accepted if non-Federal land's value is lower. Proceeds from sales or exchanges will go to a fund for land acquisition in the National Forest System. The Secretary of the Air Force must approve the sale or exchange of specified land parcels, with reimbursement of costs incurred by the Secretary, including real estate broker commissions. SEC. 4. ADMINISTRATION. Land acquired by the United States under this Act shall be subject to the Weeks Act and administered according to National Forest System laws. The described land is withdrawn from public land, mining, and mineral leasing laws.
